info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 18 at 2:09PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Richmond, south central Newberry, central Edgefield, north central Barnwell, southwestern Lexington, Aiken, Saluda and northeastern McCormick Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 209 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles south of Ninety Six Historic Site to 6 miles northwest of Graniteville to near Hephzibah. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Aiken, North Augusta, Batesburg-Leesville, Aiken Mall, Augusta, Clearwater, Belvedere, Edgefield, Saluda, Johnston, New Ellenton, Jackson, Prosperity, Ridge Spring, Glendale, Edgefield County Airport, Midtown, Citizens Park, Augusta Regional Airport and USC Aiken. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 2 and 44. Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 8 and 15. Interstate 520 in South Carolina between mile markers 16 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
